page.title: 09Quedgeley.
page.content:
Until the dual carriageway road was built in 1979 to link Gloucester with the M5 motorway, Bristol Road was part of the A38, nicknamed "the longest lane in England". Large areas of the land were owned by the R.A.F. A vast building programme in the last 10 years has linked Quedgeley with Hard- wicke and Tuffley.
Population Figures: 1979 Hardwicke 820 Quedgeley 1140 1983 Hardwicke 2022 Quedgeley 4343 1996 (anticipated) combined 13000
Building of factories and warehouses south of the Cole Avenue roundabout has just started. Tesco's new store (1984) and free bus service caused misgivings to some Gloucester traders. It is likely that Quedgeley will soon become part of Gloucester.
